v1.about:
Financial services executives generating $500K-$10M+ are turning LinkedIn into their #1 source of institutional deal flow. Without cold outreach, without violating compliance, and without becoming "influencers."

You've built a respectable firm, but:

‚Üí 80%+ of your revenue comes from referrals and warm intros
‚Üí Your "little black book" is finite, people retire, relationships fade, deals dry up
‚Üí You're losing opportunities to less qualified competitors with better positioning
‚Üí You watch fintech founders build scalable brands while you're stuck networking

You're one bad quarter away from scrambling for new business.

‚Äî

I get it.
I started with zero connections.
No warm introductions. No country club memberships. No generational money.
Just a girl from Georgia who didn't "know anyone."
And I was told that mattered.

So I built something different.

I grew to 70K followers. Generated 30M+ impressions. Got featured in Entrepreneur.
Not because I wanted followers.
Because I refused to beg for introductions.

‚Äî

Now my clients do the same:

David raised ¬£20M from family offices who found him on LinkedIn.
Franco generated ¬£6.5M without a single referral.
Laurent closed ‚Ç¨100M in transactions from inbound conversations.
Marc landed a $43B company client in ONE conversation.

None of them got lucky. They built systems.

‚Äî

Here's the truth:

You're not invisible because you're bad at marketing.
You're invisible because nobody taught you how to build authority in a regulated industry.

That's what I do.

‚Äî

I've coached 120+ founders globally.
Ranked Top 1% in Sales & Marketing UK.
Contracted with the UK-GCC Private Capital Alliance connecting institutional capital.

But none of that matters if it doesn't work for you.

‚Äî

Ready to escape the Rolodex trap?

DM me "ROLODEX"

‚Äî

Your network got you here.
Your authority will get you there.

‚Äì Mariam

** I currently take on only two new 1:1 strategy clients per month due to the depth of work and my current capacity. Please reach out regardless, you can always be waitlisted for the next available spot. I‚Äôm taking calls. **
